attributes.action: Award Kenneth Mathieson Dalglish M.B.E. a Knighthood for services to Association Football and Charity
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: "As a player: 1969-1990 Celtic & Liverpool 1971-1986 Scotland 102 caps 30 goals (both national records) The first to score 100 league goals in both the Scottish and English leagues. PFA Players’ Player of the Year 1983 Football Writers’ Association Player of the Year 1979, 1983 Inductee to both the Scottish & English Football Hall of Fame As a manager: 1985-2000 Liverpool, Blackburn Rovers, Blackburn Rovers (Director of Football), Newcastle United, Celtic (Director of Football), Celtic Awards 1985/86 Manager of the year award 1987/88 Manager of the year award 1989/90 Manager of the year award 1996/97 Manager of the year award In 2004, Kenny and his wife Marina founded The Marina Dalglish Appeal to raise money for breast cancer funding. His endless dedication to the families of the Hillsborough Tragedy Victims both in the direct aftermath and to this day.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
